description.narrative: The goal of the project is to support the work of 8rafiki Oy established affiliated company. The Kenyan company will produce wood framed sunglasses from local timber and will employ disadvantaged Kenyan youth in the sunglass production. At first the sungla sses will be sold in Finland but the company aims to expand its markets to other countries as well. World Vision will find youth from the slums to work in the sunglass production and train the youth in working life skills and life skills. World Vision will establish a learning environment for the youth who are employed in the company. The learning environment is used to train the youth in professional skills needed in the sunglass production such as woodwork. The employees can also use the learning environm ent for practicing the production skills. The youth who will be participating in the trainings will be employed in the affiliated company in Kenya. A Finnish carpenter will train the youth in woodwork with the mentor youths who will already receive their t raining in 2017. The project will also utilize Kenyan experts in the life skills training and possibly also in training the youth in woodwork. The trainings are free of charge. WV Kenya will choose the participants with the company. World Vision will monit or the impact of the project on the youth's employability as well as how well the youth's skills answer to the company's needs. The lessons learned from this project will be used when if successful the company expands its business into other developing cou ntries. World Vision has worked to increase the employability of the youth in Korogocho slum in Nairobi since 2005. The youth who participate in the youth employment projects face multiple issues such as lack of education poverty crime substance abuse or t eenage parenthood. WV offers the youth training in life skills working life skills and vocational training as well as supports the youth to entrepreneurship employment opportunities or education. World Vision's contacts with the slum youth experience in tr aining the slum youth and the existing training system will enable the affiliated company to employ disadvantaged youth.
